explanation:
For each symbol listed you need its implementation or call-graph to determine whether any callee invoked (directly or transitively) by OS_FileSysStatVolume can call back into OS_FileSysStatVolume (i.e. produce indirect recursion):

- OS_CHECK_PATHNAME, OS_CHECK_POINTER: macros used at the start of the function may expand to function calls or control-flow that could call back; inspect their expansions.
- OS_ObjectIdGetBySearch: immediate callee; must be analyzed to see if its internal logic or callbacks re-enter OS_FileSysStatVolume.
- OS_FileSys_FindVirtMountPoint: function pointer passed into OS_ObjectIdGetBySearch as the search callback; it may invoke other file-system routines (including OS_FileSysStatVolume) — must be checked.
- LOCAL_OBJID_TYPE: the object-type argument may affect which internal search paths are taken inside OS_ObjectIdGetBySearch — include to resolve search behavior.
- OS_FileSysStatVolume_Impl: immediate callee; its body must be checked for any (direct or indirect) calls back to OS_FileSysStatVolume.
- OS_ObjectIndexFromToken: callee of OS_FileSysStatVolume_Impl; include to follow that callee chain.
- OS_ObjectIdRelease: immediate callee; must be analyzed to ensure its internals (or transaction finish) do not call back.
- OS_ObjectIdTransactionInit, OS_ObjectIdFindNextMatch, OS_ObjectIdConvertToken, OS_ObjectIdTransactionCancel, OS_ObjectIdTransactionFinish: internal routines used by ObjectIdGet/Release operations — include to follow their call-chains for possible callbacks into OS_FileSysStatVolume.
- OS_printf, OS_ConsoleWrite, UT_ExecuteVaHandler: shown as callees in the static graph for functions related to instrumentation/logging; these could themselves be wrappers that call other system APIs — include to rule out indirect recursion via logging or console code.
- UT_Stub_RegisterReturnType, UT_Stub_RegisterContextWithMetaData, UT_ExecuteBasicHandler, UT_Stub_GetReturnValuePtr and their helper routines (UT_GetStubEntry, UT_ClearStubEntry, UT_SetHandlerFunction, UT_DefaultStubImpl, UtAssert_Abort, UtAssert_GetContext): the unit-test/stub infrastructure appears in the static graph; if instrumentation stubs are present in the build they may route calls through stub handlers that could (directly or indirectly) call back into OS_FileSysStatVolume. These symbols must be inspected to ensure no callback path exists.

Collecting and inspecting these symbols (source or precise call-graph) allows a complete transitive traversal from OS_FileSysStatVolume through its callees to determine whether any path leads back to OS_FileSysStatVolume (which would violate the MISRA rule).
